Reviews.Title: “Fair for the price”
Reviews.Author: Lanssing
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel because I wanted to be a real tourist in my own city, I hadn't enough money to afford a 5 star hotel, actually i had little money so I searched for cheap hotels and that's how I found Hotel El Salvador, it is nice and the rooms are clean, obviously, accordingly to the price, I didn't like he bathrooms, the toilette was as in a public wc, the shower small, and in a room for 4 people we had only 2 towels, of course we didn't expect much if we were paying about 100 pesos per night (each). The location is good; it is only a few blocks away from the cathedral and the zocalo, as well as bellas artes concert hall, which are some of the most famous tourist destinations in Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Service doesn't reflect Mexico's kindness...”
Reviews.Author: mouleyfrites
Reviews.Content: Good location; funny electronics street (each street in this area is devoted to some kind of technology or product: plumbing or electronics, bathroom fitting or vacuum cleaners. Kinda fun!). No good restaurants or bars at night (our beverage option - aside from manly man cantinas was to buy big beers through a barred security window at the Oxxo down the street - queuing with a rather scary cast of late-night characters...). Front desk clerks just got meaner every day. Don't know why. I speak Spanish, and tried really hard to be polite and respectful - even after our door broke and we were locked in our room! I think they don't like foreign visitors much. On our last day, an important friend sent a messenger to pick up the sunglasses he had left with us by mistake, and the desk clerk sent the messenger away - saying we had left the hotel - knowing we we would return in five minutes (she arranged our taxi for us and knew our schedule). Just plain mean-spirited. If they call you a taxi, establish the fare before you agree. They don't use real drivers - just friends of the hotel - and - while they can be sweet, they quadruple charge! The desk clerks have never heard the term 'radio taxi,' they say. Rooms: The outside-facing rooms are unbearably noisy. Inside rooms are small and dark - but clean and pleasant. I really like a hotel in Mexico to reflect a little of Mexico - whether through aesthetics and architecture or in the typically Mexican warmth and kindness of those who work there. This place offers neither. Restaurant staff = fun. Breakfast was nice - but a bit pricey, and nothing like free breakfasts I have had at other places in Mexico. Disappointing. If the staff had been nice all would have been fine.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the bell boys!! Rude staff”
Reviews.Author: icedusa
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for just 1 night, i planned to go to many museums and historic monuments traveling trough the "metro" subway system, the hotel location is perfect for metro, but sourrounding areas are full of electronic stores all day, its kinda noisy, all was ok, room was clean, just enough for a 3 stars hotel, room decoration is ok but nothing fancy, staff is sort of rude, i've called to reception to ask for nearby plazas, and the only answer i got from this guy "raul" was 10 minutes of standby at the phone.. then i went down the lobby area but he only gave me a poor map of mexico city,.... but this was'nt all, me and my familiy needed to leave our luggage in a safe place some hours, the hotel recepcionist kindly accepted to store or luggage in some "safe" place.. when i got my luggage back, the bell boy that was supposed to keep luggage safe was really nervous, and i was robbed 50 dls. from my backpack.. not a big deal but really dissapointing, combining the fact that my young niece noticed it's underwear was stolen too, so . beware the bellboys,, they are just 13- 16 year old kids that i suppose they get extra money by searching what to get from tourist luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Gem”
Reviews.Author: WanderingStar001
Reviews.Content: Clean reasonably priced central hotel. We paid $430 peso per night for a double room. The street where the Hotel is located is very busy during the day and if you arrive at night the surrounding area is a bit rundown, but the Hotel entrance is a welcome gem in what first appears as a not so good area. Hotel staff spoke little English which made communicating hard, but they really worked hard to please you. Safety deposit boxes were available at the front desk, hotel has its own resturant and there are many alternate choices within two blocks. About 10 minute walk from the main square and in the historic district. we walked out many times both day and night without incident. They have computers with internet access for a fee. Several 24hr food places within 2 blocks. The room was on the small size, but very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Bearable but glad to leave”
Reviews.Author: NTLibran
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby has been updated to have more of a modern feel but past that the property is in need of a makeover. Rooms are quite small and a little on the musty side, the shower pressure is very poor and soundproofing is non-existent. We were kept awake all night due to our â€˜neighboursâ€™ snoring and the next guests that moved in knew we were from Australia because they could hear us on a telephone call. There are no fridges in the rooms which makes it hard to keep any food. There is also no air-conditioning, which wasnâ€™t a problem for us as we were there in winter but I would imaging the rooms would get hot during summer. There is a Metro station about 3 blocks away from the hotel but as first timers to Mexico City we didnâ€™t find the location was all that suitable to tourists, the hotel is situated on a street of electrical shops â€“ if you need a remote control, a TV or a memory card you are set, however, if you are after food, a laundry or anything else you will have to venture further. We arrived late afternoon and didnâ€™t feel safe to go exploring in the dark so we had dinner in the hotel, the food is below average and slow to arrive but the restaurant staff are real characters. Once we were more familiar with the area we explored a little further and found some decent restaurants and shops, having said that ,we tried to be off the streets and back in the hotel by 9pm. I believe Zona Rosa is a better option if you want to feel more at ease. Some reception staff were helpful, others didnâ€™t want to know you or tell you anything. For example, we learnâ€™t on our last day that if you put down a refundable deposit they gave you a remote control to enable the cable service on the television â€“ which means you receive English speaking channels. They have 3 computers with very reasonably priced internet access available for guests, there was a number of times we wanted to use them and they werenâ€™t working, but the problems were normally rectified in under an hour. This hotel is reasonably priced and comfortable enough for a one night stay, for a longer period I would recommend looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and good deal”
Reviews.Author: patanete
Reviews.Content: I come to this hotel almost every year from 2004 after reading the first review in TripAdvisor.Here is mine. I like very much this city and think this hotel is ideal to enjoy it.All sights in the Centro Historico are a pleasant walk away,the El Salvador street are vey busy by day but a little intimidating by night,like all the old part of the city,not very well lighted,but I never felt unsafe,and I go out and return to the hotel late and sometimes very late.The Salto de Agua metro station are four blocks away and this line takes you to the zona rosa directly and also to Tapo bus station.There is also nearer the San Juan de Letran metro st. but that line is not very useful and you must to transfer in Salto de Agua to go to other parts of the city.Taxi is easy because the hotel is 50 meters of the Eje Central a very busy avenue.If you prefer,the hotel calls you a safer taxi.Inside the hotel,is all quietness,is a modern buiding,well maintained ,with five floors and a lift.The rooms are very clean,carpeted,cable TV,good mattresses and big windows open to several courts.The bathrooms are good too,simple but with enough light and hot water. Desk people are very friendly,I can say it,there are three internet terminals,but not cheap.And a restaurant that looks uninspiring,but I never use it,canÂ´t talk about it,but there are endless options outside,althought by night many restaurants close early Well,and the better thing is the price,look into their website.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient and clean”
Reviews.Author: KINGKONG3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a tour, so I can't comment on prices. However, this hotel was clean, comfortable and convenient for the Zocalo and subway stations. There's a lift, Internet access, and the room was dark and quiet - ideal following a hectic day in the city. The area felt safe, and there was a 24 hour convenience store a block away which was handy. Certainly, if I returned to Mexico City I would have no problem with staying here again - it was cheap and cheerful!

Reviews.Title: “A great & cheap find!”
Reviews.Author: funnychap24
Reviews.Content: A steal--I think--for 25 USD (one person). More than comfortable room. Friendly, helpful staff--ask for a map of subway system (gave me one free) which also has lots of info. about country. 3 blocks from Salto del Angel or Bellas Artes subway stops (though these stops are confusing when trying to navigate inside). Loved hotel & will choose again without a doubt! Check out their website.
